etymology.description: 医(醫) (yī, "medicine; doctor") + 院(院) (yuàn, "courtyard; institution") = an institution for practicing medicine -> hospital
etymology.interpretation: A 院(院) (yuàn, "institution") where 医(醫) (yī, "medicine") is practiced is a place where people go to receive medical treatment and healthcare.

examples.chinese: 我去医院(我去醫院)，看医生(看醫生)。
examples.english: I go to the hospital to see a doctor.

examples.chinese: 医院在城市中心(醫院在城市中心)，设备先进(設備先進)。
examples.pinyin: Yīyuàn zài chéngshì zhōngxīn, shèbèi xiānjìn.
examples.english: The hospital is located in the city center with advanced equipment.

examples.chinese: 医生在医院救治病人(醫生在醫院救治病人)。
examples.english: Doctors treat patients in the hospital.
